problem: Find the sum of all values of $x$ that satisfy the equation $|2x+3| = 9$.
solution: For the equation $|2x+3|=9$, we have two cases: either $2x+3=9$ or $2x+3=-9$. Solving $2x+3=9$ gives $2x=6$, so $x=3$. Solving $2x+3=-9$ gives $2x=-12$, so $x=-6$. The sum of the values is $3 + (-6) = \boxed{-3}$.
